title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Construction equipment industry expected to post 2–4 per cent growth: Crisil Ratings
AXISCADES Technologies posts 89% jump in Q2 profit at ₹23 crore
India best placed to host electronics manufacturing mega hubs, says Syrma SGS CEO Satendra Singh
DPIIT: 13 PLI filings for white goods ₹1,914 cr
items.summary:
- **DPIIT** received 13 applications with ₹1,914 crore commitment under the **PLI** for **White Goods**; window: 15 Sept–10 Nov 2025.
- Among them, 1 existing **PLI beneficiary** adds ₹15 crore; 9 aim to make **AC components** worth ₹1,816 crore; 4 plan ₹98 crore for **LED components**.
- Total **PLI White Goods** now ₹10,335 crore from 80 beneficiaries; projected production ₹1.72 lakh crore; ~60,000 direct jobs; domestic value addition to rise to 75–80%.

items.title: Cabinet okays ₹45,000 crore package to support exports, MSMEs amid global headwinds
AP-Tillman pact for Vizag data centre
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- AP government and *Tillman Global Holdings* signed an MoU to build a **300 MW** hyperscale data centre campus in Visakhapatnam with about **₹15,000 crore** investment.
- The 40-acre project is expected to create **200-300 direct** and **800-1,000 indirect** jobs by 2028, boosting digital infrastructure, logistics, cloud networks and allied services.
- Tillman will supply investment, technology and equipment; land allotments and incentives will be managed by state departments.

items.title: India's power grid struggles to absorb soaring solar supply
items.summary:
- The grid is struggling to absorb a rapid surge in solar installations, causing increased curtailment and underscoring the urgent need for *large-scale energy storage* and better grid integration.
- Solar curtailment rose to about *12%* in October, with some days denying as much as *40%* of output, while coal plants remain online to meet sunset demand.
- The trend is worsened by wind curtailment and about *44 GW* of renewables awaiting PPAs, highlighting the push for grid modernization and dispatchable storage.

items.title: NTPC plans 5-10 mt coal-to-synthetic natural gas facility
items.summary:
- NTPC plans to set up a 5-10 million tonnes per year **coal-to-synthetic natural gas (SNG)** facility and will appoint a technical consultant in the current financial year.
- The project would convert high-ash coal from NTPC's captive mines into SNG, usable for power generation or chemicals, with estimated production costs of **$10-12/mmbtu**.
- Beyond this project, NTPC targets **149 GW** of power capacity by FY32 and is pursuing nuclear energy expansion toward **30 GW by 2047**.

items.title: Tata Steel says monitoring EU, UK policy developments to prioritise, optimise decarbonisation capex
Microsoft expands Danish quantum facility with second lab
items.summary:
- Microsoft expands its *Lyngby* quantum facility outside Copenhagen by adding a second lab, making it the largest quantum site globally.
- The upgrade will support the *Majorana 1 chip* and reinforce transatlantic collaboration between Denmark and Europe, accelerating quantum research.
- Microsoft says its total quantum investments in Denmark exceed *1 billion Danish crowns*, signaling a long-term commitment to commercializing quantum tech in Europe.

items.title: Synopsys to cut about 10% of its workforce
items.summary:
- **Synopsys** plans to lay off about 2,000 employees, roughly 10% of its workforce, to redirect investments toward growth opportunities.
- It completed the $35 billion **Ansys** acquisition and reported weaker Q3 results, leading to pre-tax charges of **$300–$350 million**.
- The charges will mainly cover severance, one-time termination benefits, and costs related to site closures.

items.title: IBM says 'Loon' chip shows path to useful quantum computers by 2029
Four hydrogen valleys coming up across India to demonstrate complete green hydrogen value chain
NTPC ramps up nuclear push, eyes 16 states
items.author: Saurav Anand, ETEnergyWorld
items.summary:
- NTPC is in talks with *16 states* to acquire land for nuclear plants, aiming to add **30 GW** by **2047** as part of the **100 GW** target.
- It will develop **PHWRs** of **700–1,600 MW**, with standalone for smaller sizes and possible foreign collaborations for the 1,600 MW units.
- The push underpins a non-fossil base-load to back a **500 GW renewables** target by **2030**, with costs of roughly ₹15–₹20k crore per GW and total capex around ₹4.5–₹6 lakh crore, including the Mahi Banswara project with NPCIL.

items.title: Collins Aerospace opens new 26-acre facility in Bengaluru
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The Collins India Operations Centre (CIOC) at KIADB Aerospace Park, Devanahalli, Bengaluru, on a *26-acre* site with **₹880 crore** investment, is Collins' largest manufacturing facility in India and will create over *2,000 jobs*.
- The facility spans *1.25 lakh sq ft* and uses *Industry 4.0* systems, **AI**, additive manufacturing, and robotics; by 2026 it will host *2,200+ employees* and produce seats, lighting, cargo systems, sensors, navigation systems, water solutions, and evacuation slides.
- RTX's *Collins Aerospace* reinforces its Karnataka commitment, bolstering India's aerospace hub status; Collins already employs *6,500+* in India and recently announced an Engineering Development and Test Centre in Bengaluru.

items.title: Tata Steel Q2 net profit up 4x to ₹3,183 cr on India ops
items.summary:
- Tata Steel's consolidated net profit rose to **₹3,183.09 crore**, more than four times the prior year's **₹758.84 crore**, led by strong *India operations*. 
- Total income rose to **₹59,052.84 crore**, up over 8% YoY, with India revenue around **₹38,592 crore** (incl. NINL). 
- Net debt declined to **₹87,040 crore**, quarterly capex at **₹3,250 crore** and UK debt down by **£540 million**, amid ongoing decarbonisation and portfolio moves.

items.title: Cosmo First forms JV with Filmax in South Korea
items.summary:
- Cosmo First forms a **50-50** joint venture with Filmax Corporation to introduce and scale its business verticals in South Korea.
- The venture will focus on **specialty films**, chemicals, and rigid packaging, combining Cosmo First’s technology with Filmax’s market presence to reach international markets via Cosmo First’s network.
- The partners will hold equal equity stakes and aim to strengthen global positions in the films and chemicals market, driving growth and setting new industry benchmarks.

items.title: BorgWarner to supply 7-in-1 iDM to Chinese OEM
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary: - BorgWarner has won a contract to supply its **7-in-1 Integrated Drive Module (iDM)** to a Chinese OEM for a next-gen **hybrid SUV**.\n- The iDM packs two motors, high-voltage hairpin winding, dual inverter with OBC, DCDC, battery boost, VCU, PDU and eGear in one compact unit, up to **160 kW**, **450V**, **>3,400 Nm** torque, and up to **1,350 r/min**; mass production starts in 2026.\n- Stefan Demmerle of BorgWarner says their system enables an efficient, customized iDM architecture for regional hybrid applications.

items.title: Gaganyaan mission: ISRO conducts important test on main parachutes
Bosch net profit rises 3.4% to ₹554 cr in Q2 FY26; revenue grows 9%
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- *Bosch India* posted Q2FY26 PAT of ₹554 crore, up 3.4% YoY, as revenue climbed 9.1% to ₹4,795 crore. 
- Segment performance showed automotive products up 11.9%, Power Solutions up 9.5%, and a big rebound in two-wheeler sales driven by OBD II sensors. 
- *Profitability* benefited from favourable mix and cost optimisation, even as the Beyond Mobility unit declined 14.4% post-divestment.

items.title: Asian Paints Q2 net profit up 43%, revenue up 6%
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Asian Paints* Q2 net profit rose about **43%** to ₹993.59 crore, with revenue from operations up about **6.27%** to ₹8,531.27 crore.
- Domestic decorative business grew double-digit in volume (**10.9%**) and ~**6%** in value, despite monsoon headwinds; international markets also posted double-digit revenue growth.
- PBT climbed to ₹1,391.52 crore, aided by stronger automotive/industrial coatings and the expansion of Beautiful Homes stores.

items.title: Niveshaay leads ₹325cr investment in Waaree Storage
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- **Niveshaay** led a ₹325 crore round for *Waaree Energy Storage Systems* (WESSPL), as part of a ₹1,000 crore fundraising plan. 
- The funds will expand *cell and pack manufacturing*, strengthen *engineering and validation*, and scale containerised BESS across India and select markets. 
- India’s storage push is supported by **PLI**, **ESO**, and viability funding, with installations projected to rise from 0.4 GWh in 2024 to ~200 GWh by 2030.

items.title: HAL net profit rises 10.5% in Q2 FY26 on higher revenue
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- HAL reported consolidated net profit of ₹1,66,905 crore for Q2 FY26, up 10.5% YoY.
- Revenue from operations rose 10.9% YoY to ₹6,62,861 crore, with total income at ₹7,51,628 crore, up 15.3%, and sequential profit up 20.62% from ₹1,38,377 crore in Q1.
- In H1 FY26, HAL's net profit rose 3.57% to ₹3,05,282 crore, while total income grew 12.75% to ₹13,08,238 crore.

items.title: Inside India’s rail tech revolution: e2E Rail’s electronic leap with Kavach 4.0
Lupin Manufacturing opens dedicated oncology block at Vizag
Cosmo First logs 2% rise in Q2 net profit to ₹47 crore
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Cosmo First reports Q2 FY26 PAT of ₹47 crore, up from ₹46 crore, with revenue at ₹919 crore and **EBITDA** ₹128 crore, aided by higher volumes.
- **EBITDA** growth came from a 25% rise in sales volume and the performance of its *specialty chemicals subsidiary*, but margins were pressured by lower BOPP/BOPET film prices, higher US tariffs, and stabilisation costs for new film lines.
- Management expects full utilisation of the new lines by Q4 FY26, with three new products from the *specialty chemicals subsidiary*, and expansion in Zigly and Cosmo Plastech, including an **ESD PET sheet** launch.

items.title: Godavari Biorefineries narrows Q2 FY26 net loss to ₹41.6 crore on 34% revenue growth
GM wants parts makers to pull supply chains from China
Boeing keeps up strong delivery pace in October
items.summary:
- Boeing delivered *53 jets* in October, bringing the year total to *493* as it eyes its highest annual output since 2018. 
- The October mix included *39* of the **737 MAX** (nine to Southwest, five to Ryanair) and *13* widebodies (7 × 787s, 2 × 777 freighters, 4 × 767s). 
- October net orders were *8* after cancellations (15 new orders), with a backlog of *5,911* and regulators approving raising the **737** output to *42 per month*.

items.title: Adani-Cement & Coolbrook to deploy RDH tech in AP plant
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The world’s first commercial *RotoDynamic Heater (RDH)* will be deployed at Adani Cement’s Boyareddypalli plant in Andhra Pradesh to electrify the calcination process.
- The initial phase aims to cut about 60,000 tonnes of CO₂ annually with potential to scale tenfold, advancing **net-zero by 2050** as validated by the **SBTi** and Coolbrook’s CO₂ goals.
- Powered by Adani’s renewable energy, the project delivers **emission-free heat** for decarbonization, supporting higher **AF usage** and a target of 60% green power by FY28.

items.title: Trade deal talks between India and US near conclusion
L&T Technology Services, Autodesk partner to launch AI-led digital manufacturing hub in Vadodara
Can Tenneco Clean Air India’s IPO deliver long term gains for investors?
Thermax Q2 profit drops 40% to ₹119 crore on cost overruns
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- **Thermax**'s Q2 consolidated profit fell 40% YoY to ₹119 crore, hit by *project cost overruns* in the *industrial infra* segment.
- Revenue slipped 5% YoY to ₹2,474 crore; **PBT** down 35% to ₹174 crore, with ₹42 crore of additional costs on one project.
- Order balance stood at ₹12,300 crore, up 6%; standalone PAT rose to ₹226 crore aided by ₹141 crore dividend income.

items.title: OECD panel flags excess steel supplies; China exports surge
items.summary:
- **OECD** panel flags excess global steel supplies as **China** exports surge, with worldwide capacity above 680 million tonnes.
- **China** exports have risen about 10% this year and have doubled since 2020-2024 as domestic demand weakens, reshaping global trade.
- **DGTR** of India proposes phased safeguard duties on some flat steel imports (12%, 11.5%, 11%), while industry seeks a 25% barrier to curb China imports.

items.title: India-Russia summit to boost SMRs and localisation
items.author: Dipanjan Roy Chaudhury, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The 23rd India-Russia summit will push civil nuclear cooperation, including small modular reactors (*SMRs*) and the localisation of nuclear plant equipment.
- Rosatom and India's Department of Atomic Energy discussed expanding large- and small-scale nuclear projects and progress at *KNPP*, with Unit 3 safety testing and Units 4, 5/6 under construction.
- The talks also cover broader cooperation in the *nuclear fuel cycle* and future partnerships beyond KNPP to advance India's nuclear power ambitions.

items.title: Tata Power plans to set up largest solar wafers, ingots making plant
items.summary:
- *Tata Power* plans to build India's largest solar **wafers and ingots** plant with a **10 GW** capacity, tying into its solar manufacturing chain.
- The project would bolster *Tata Power*'s existing **4.9 GW** of integrated cell and module capacity and aligns with India's push to localize wafers/ingots to cut **imports**.
- The company is exploring **federal and state financial support** and will decide total investment in the next two months.

items.title: Centre earmarks ₹100 crore for biomass-to-hydrogen pilots to cut fossil fuel imports
India extends ₹4,000 cr line of credit to Bhutan
items.author: TNN
items.summary:
- India announced a concessional ₹4,000 crore line of credit for Bhutan's energy projects and pledged rail connectivity to Gelephu and Samtse.
- PM Modi and Bhutan's king inaugurated the 1020 MW Punatsangchhu-II hydro project, with a new over-1,000 MW plant boosting Bhutan's capacity by about 40%.
- The two nations signed MoUs on renewable energy, mental health, and healthcare, plus border infrastructure plans and an immigration checkpoint near Gelephu; India also contributed ₹10,000 crore to Bhutan's Five-Year Plan.

items.title: Aim to make India global hub for green hydrogen production: Pralhad Joshi
JSW may sell 50% in Bhushan Power to JFE
Striking Boeing workers to vote Thursday on offer with lower overall bonus
items.summary:
- The more than 3,200 *Boeing Defense* workers on strike will vote Thursday on a new offer that lowers the overall ratification bonus but pays more cash upfront.
- The offer includes a 24% wage increase over five years and a $6,000 upfront bonus if approved (up from $3,000), but cuts $4,000 in later bonuses.
- The strike has delayed F-15 deliveries, and the IAM has accused Boeing of bargaining in bad faith while it hires permanent replacement workers.

items.title: Container Corporation of India Q2 profit edges up 3% to ₹379 crore
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- CONCOR reported consolidated profit attributable to owners of **₹379 crore** for Q2 FY26, up **3.9%** from **₹365 crore** in the year-ago quarter.
- Revenue from operations stood at **₹2,355 crore** in Q2 FY26, nearly flat vs **₹2,288 crore** in Q2 FY25, while total expenses rose to **₹1,945 crore**.
- The board approved a second interim dividend of **₹2.60 per share** for FY26, with the record date of **20 November 2025**.

items.title: Boeing says tariff issues won't hit its India business, gears up to increase investments in the country
Vivo tops India smartphone market in Q3; Apple clocks highest shipments of 5 mn iPhones: IDC
Tech industry groups urge MeitY to refine AI content rules to boost innovation, for global alignment
AMD expects profit to triple by 2030, data center chip market to grow to $1 trillion
Tata Power to buy 40% stake in Bhutan hydro SPV
items.summary:
- Tata Power will acquire a 40% equity stake in a Bhutan SPV for approximately **₹1,572 crore** to develop the 1,125 MW *Dorjilung Hydro Power Project*. 
- The SPV will be jointly held by Tata Power and **Druk Green Power Corporation** and the project cost is about **₹13,100 crore**. 
- The deal aims to bolster Tata Power's renewable energy portfolio and accelerate its *clean energy transition*.

items.title: BASF India partners with CleanMax for hybrid solar–wind captive power project in Gujarat
Paras Defence wins ₹35.68cr MoD counter-drone orders
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Paras Defence* and Space Technologies Ltd. secured two MoD orders worth ₹35.68 crore for *Portable Counter-Drone Systems*, to be delivered by May 2026. 
- Its subsidiary, *Paras Anti-Drone Technologies Pvt. Ltd.*, won an MoD order of ₹3.95 crore for *Radio Frequency jammers*, also due by May 2026. 
- The awards signal growing reliance on **indigenous counter-UAV** capabilities and bolster India’s defence preparedness.
